question_text: Which of the following statements best defines isomers in coordination compounds?
options: Compounds with different chemical formulas and similar physical properties
Compounds with the same chemical formula but different arrangements of atoms
Compounds with the same spatial arrangement of atoms and different formulas
Compounds that differ only in oxidation state of the central metal ion
correct_answer: Compounds with the same chemical formula but different arrangements of atoms
explanation: Isomers are defined as compounds that have the same chemical formula but differ in the arrangement of atoms. This difference can affect their physical and chemical properties.
